What book is The movie High Road to China based on?

The movieHigh Road to China is based on the bookHigh Road to Chinawritten byÂ  Jon Cleary

High Road to China(A Novel)Published by William Morrow - 1/1/1977

The daughter of an American tycoon, Eve, had just arrived in England when she finds her father had been kidnapped back in Shanghai. The ransom was demanded but the closing date was only 18 days away - and Eve finds that her only hope was to fly - (in 1920) - three British two-seaters.

High Road to China

written byJon Cleary

Published by William Morrow - 1/1/1977

The daughter of an American tycoon, Eve, had just arrived in England when she finds her father had been kidnapped back in Shanghai. The ransom was demanded but the closing date was only 18 days away - and Eve finds that her only hope was to fly - (in 1920) - three British two-seaters.

Four-Cornered Circle

written byJon Cleary

Published by Severn House Pub Limited - 1/1/2007

How far would you go for someone you loved? - Twins Marie and Louise have always been close, but with Maries life on the up, Louise cant help but feel what, exactly? If not envious, than at least a little put out that her own situation divorced and drifting compares so unfavourably. But when tragedy strikes Louise must put her jealousy aside and decide just how far shes prepared to go to protect her sister . . .

Dilemma

written byJon Cleary

Published by G K Hall & Company - 1/1/2000

With all evidence in the killing of Norma Glaze pointing to her vanished husband, Scobie Malone's latest case appears to be a cinch, but all is not as it seems when a friend of Scobie's is implicated in the murder.

Did you know that the movie High Road to China is based on the book High Road to China?

A biplane pilot is saddled with a spoiled industrialist's daughter on a search for her missing father through Asia that eventually involves them in a struggle against a Chinese warlord.
